sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from "react";
import Card from "react-bootstrap/Card"
import ListGroup from "react-bootstrap/ListGroup"
import ListGroupItem from "react-bootstrap/ListGroupItem"
import Button from "react-bootstrap/Button"
import { getDistanceToCoffeeShop } from "../../custom_modules/getDistanceToCoffeeShop";

const CoffeeShopCard = ( props ) => {

    const [distance, setDistance] = useState(null)

    const currentLocation= `${props.location.latitude},${props.location.longitude}`
    setDistance(getDistanceToCoffeeShop.distanceToCoffeeShop(currentLocation, props.coffeeShop.formatted_address))
    return (
        <Card style={{ width: '18rem' }} >
            {console.log(distance)}
            <Card.Img variant="top" src={"https://images.pexels.com/photos/302899/pexels-photo-302899.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&w=1260&h=750&dpr=1"} />
            <Card.Body>
                <Card.Title>{props.coffeeShop.name}</Card.Title>
                <Card.Text>
                Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of
                the card's content.
                </Card.Text>
            </Card.Body>
            <ListGroup className="list-group-flush">
                <ListGroupItem>Cras justo odio</ListGroupItem>
                <ListGroupItem>Dapibus ac facilisis in</ListGroupItem>
                <ListGroupItem>Vestibulum at eros</ListGroupItem>
            </ListGroup>
            <Card.Body>
                <Button variant="secondary">Add To Kaffico</Button>
                <Button variant="outline-secondary">Directions</Button>
            </Card.Body>
        </Card>
    )
}

export default CoffeeShopCard
